body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

When I query a terminated workflow like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/251288/213614824-ccdbfbbb-e3ff-43a6-aa36-e983ccced5d8.png)

I wait for a while and then get:

`Error: 4 DEADLINE_EXCEEDED: context deadline exceeded`

**Describe the solution you'd like**

It would be nice if I immediately got back an error that said something like:

This Workflow Execution was terminated before the WorkflowTaskStarted event, which means it can't be Queried.

**Additional context**

I queried a list of workflows and it took me a while to figure out it was because some of them had histories like this. Adding this new error message would help future devs avoid spending time wondering/debugging.
title: Return descriptive error when querying a terminated workflow without `WorkflowTaskStarted`
